To help you do that, Parks Canada is giving away free 2017 Discovery Passes. You can order your free pass online or you can get it in person when visiting a Parks Canada location.

#ScamAlert
Beware of pushy door-to-door “salespeople” claiming to represent ENERGY STAR. ENERGY STAR is a brand; it’s the symbol that Canadians use to easily identify energy-efficient products. ENERGY STAR never performs unsolicited energy assessments or visits homeowners to sell products, nor does it authorize others to do so. For more information, please visit: http://ow.ly/im8N3088r5a
 
To learn how to protect yourself from other types of scams, please visit http://ow.ly/RvYM3088ran

#DYK the best before date on food packaging doesn’t mean that the food is unsafe to eat after that date? It generally means that the food will be past its peak freshness. 

Take advantage of last-minute store deals on items to be “immediately enjoyed” and save on your grocery bill. You can also save money on fresh produce by seeking out “ugly” or misshapen items that are usually sold at a discount. 
Check out these other tips for saving on your grocery bill: http://ow.ly/3Y06307xAqN

Did you know giving children, family and friends red envelopes or packets filled with money is a tradition on #ChineseNewYear?

The significance is in the red paper, not the actual money inside the packet. The color red symbolizes energy, happiness and good luck. Sending red packets is a way to send good wishes to your loved ones. 

Does your family have any money traditions?

Moving scams are on the rise—don’t get hijacked.

Hijacking refers to the use of reputable movers’ brand names on Google or other search engines to attract consumers to non-affiliated movers. Often times, these “rogue movers” do not actually possess any trucks or equipment at all.

Check our checklist to help you make a smooth move: http://ow.ly/4lCh307KKok

Many Canadian cities are looking their best for #Canada150, and patriotic travellers might want to take of advantage of cheaper flights so they can check out the sights.

Winter is considered by many as the “off season” for flights and accommodation, after the holiday travel boom. Book on a weekend to avoid rates that spike Monday to Friday to accommodate busier business travellers.
